item.description:
Welcome to Brave Boat Book Group, a non-fiction book discussion group!
We read and discuss most any genre of non-fiction including, biography, memoir, history, science, politics, nature, the arts, cooking, travel, current affairs, interpersonal relations... you name it. Our goal is to learn about all sorts of new ideas, things, trends, and cultures - and to make new friends in the process. The only ground rules are that everyone is at all times respectful of the ideas and opinions of others, and that everyone be conscious of allowing others time to speak.  Be nice. Be brief.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
This Month's Selection:

In the Heart of the Sea: The Tragedy of the Whaleship Essex
by Nathaniel Philbrick, 2006, 302pp.
The ordeal of the whaleship Essex was an event as mythic in the nineteenth century as the sinking of the Titanic was in the twentieth. In 1819, the Essex left Nantucket for the South Pacific with twenty crew members aboard. In the middle of the South Pacific the ship was rammed and sunk by an angry sperm whale. The crew drifted for more than ninety days in three tiny whaleboats, succumbing to weather, hunger, disease, and ultimately turning to drastic measures in the fight for survival. Nathaniel Philbrick uses little-known documents-including a long-lost account written by the ship's cabin boy-and penetrating details about whaling and the Nantucket community to reveal the chilling events surrounding this epic maritime disaster. An intense and mesmerizing read, In the Heart of the Sea is a monumental work of history forever placing the Essex tragedy in the American historical canon.

National Book Award Winner
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

When: Last Wednesday of the month - 6:30pm.

Where: The Farm Bar & Grille in Dover, NH.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Membership: Your first meeting is free. After that, membership dues are $2/meeting, or $12 per year. Dues may be paid in person, or online here: Brave Boat Membership Dues

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Brave Boat Book Group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. This includes any risks associated with driving to and from meetings, and consumption of alcohol before, during or after meetings. Participation in this activity is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

Meetings are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Brave Boat Books: In the Heart of the Sea
